title: How to Make Apple Tealight Candles

steps.title: Remove each apple's stem.
steps.content: Remove each apple's stem. Simply hold the apple by the stem, either twist the apple around until the stem comes off, don't twist and give the stem a hard pull, or slice out the stem with a craft knife.

steps.title: Create the candle holder shape in the top center of the apple.
steps.content: Create the candle holder shape in the top center of the apple. Place the tealight on top of the apple and trace around the bottom with a pen or pencil.

steps.title: Cut out the traced hole using a craft knife.
steps.content: Cut out the traced hole using a craft knife. Plunge the craft knife into the apple along the traced line, cutting a round hole. Cut about 1" down (2.54 cm) to create a hole deep enough to hold the candle.

steps.title: Cut two “X” shapes in the center of the circle with the craft knife.
steps.content: Cut two “X” shapes in the center of the circle with the craft knife. Cutting the X shapes will make it easier to remove the center of the apple.

steps.title: Scoop out center area with a spoon.
steps.content: Scoop out center area with a spoon. The pre-cut X shapes should lift easily. Then continue to hollow out the apple with your spoon. Scrape around the sides of the pre-cut hole to create a smooth center and base to hold your tealight.

steps.title: Drop the tealight candle into the hole.
steps.content: Drop the tealight candle into the hole. Light a wax tealight candle after adding it. If using battery operated candles though, be sure to turn on the candle before dropping it into the hole.

steps.title: Decide how you will use the apple tealight candle holders.
steps.content: Decide how you will use the apple tealight candle holders. For a fall theme, you could fill a large tub with water and fill it with lit floating apples. A large, Golden Delicious apple perched upon a small saucer placed as a centerpiece on each table might be a great way to celebrate your child’s teacher at the next teacher's luncheon. A tall cylindrical vase filled 3/4 full with water would be beautiful with a floating apple candle holder on top! Also, the water could be colored to compliment the apple or a theme of choice.
